pullrequest.title: Port the spectral_integrator analysis module into yt.fields

content.raw: This is leftover from the original code, but I think the field that is really required here is `H_nuclei_density`.  Currently, `H_number_density` is n_HI.  If you're tracking primordial chemistry in the simulation, the HI number density and total H number density (H nuclei density) are likely going to be pretty different in the regime where this code will be used.  I think this may be worth fixing.  The other benefit of switching to `H_nuclei_density` is that the fallback in place below is already covered by that field definition.
content.html: This is leftover from the original code, but I think the field that is really required here is H_nuclei_density. Currently, H_number_density is n_HI. If you're tracking primordial chemistry in the simulation, the HI number density and total H number density (H nuclei density) are likely going to be pretty different in the regime where this code will be used. I think this may be worth fixing. The other benefit of switching to H_nuclei_density is that the fallback in place below is already covered by that field definition.

content.raw: Isn't the X-ray emissivity proportional to the density of ionized hydrogen only? This is how it's defined for APEC--I'm not sure how it's defined in Cloudy.
content.html: Isn't the X-ray emissivity proportional to the density of ionized hydrogen only? This is how it's defined for APEC--I'm not sure how it's defined in Cloudy.

pullrequest.title: Port the spectral_integrator analysis module into yt.fields

content.raw: Any further thoughts on this issue, @brittonsmith? I'm pretty sure that the H density should be ionized H, unless I am missing something.
content.html: Any further thoughts on this issue, Britton Smith? I'm pretty sure that the H density should be ionized H, unless I am missing something.

pullrequest.title: Port the spectral_integrator analysis module into yt.fields

content.raw: Sorry, had a moving truck arrive yesterday.  The emissivities from the Cloudy tables are scaled with n_H total.  This is also the input parameter they get run with, so you need to supply n_H total to get the interpolation right.  I think we'll have to do it differently for each table.
content.html: Sorry, had a moving truck arrive yesterday. The emissivities from the Cloudy tables are scaled with n_H total. This is also the input parameter they get run with, so you need to supply n_H total to get the interpolation right. I think we'll have to do it differently for each table.

pullrequest.title: Port the spectral_integrator analysis module into yt.fields

content.raw: I've replaced `H_number_density` with `H_nuclei_density` because it makes more sense. For APEC the whole thing will be ionized anyway.
content.html: I've replaced H_number_density with H_nuclei_density because it makes more sense. For APEC the whole thing will be ionized anyway.

pullrequest.title: Port the spectral_integrator analysis module into yt.fields

content.raw: There is another difference--one uses the `em_0` and `em_Z` interpolators and the other uses the `emp_0` and `emp_Z` interpolators. I'm not sure it's a simple matter of combining them.
content.html: There is another difference--one uses the em_0 and em_Z interpolators and the other uses the emp_0 and emp_Z interpolators. I'm not sure it's a simple matter of combining them.

pullrequest.title: Port the spectral_integrator analysis module into yt.fields

description:
The `spectral_integrator` analysis module creates X-ray emission fields in user-specified energy bands. Per our recent discussion on analysis modules, I'm moving this under `yt.fields`.

I've also simplified the signature of `add_xray_emissivity_field` somewhat, to combine two metallicity parameters (allowing for a constant metallicity vs a metallicity field) into one. 

This version also optionally creates "intensity" fields for cosmologically distant objects which are suitable for projections. 

Backwards-compatibility with the old `analysis_modules` version has been accounted for by putting a link to the new module there and a deprecation warning. Deprecated keyword arguments are also handled.

This version does not allow one to supply an alternative table filename: it must be either `apec_emissivity.h5` or `cloudy_emissivity.h5`. 

The new files (not included in this PR) are not backwards-compatible with the old analysis module: I have sacrificed backwards-compatiblity for considerable simplification of code. 

I've also added answer tests. I've manually checked this version against the old one for consistency. 

What needs to happen before this can be un-marked as WIP:

* Pull Request #2471 needs to be merged in, and the emissivity data needs to be downloaded to `"supp_data_dir"` on the build box.
* Update the documentation.

UPDATE: Docs are in. This is ready to test after `apec_emissivity_v2.h5` and `cloudy_emissivity_v2.h5` are put on the build box (ping @xarthisius).
